Inframark has developed the Risk Management (RMP) and Process Safety Management (PSM) Plan to implement EPA Section 112(r) of the Clean Air Act, 40 CFR 68 as well as 29 C.F.R. 1910.119, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Standard regulating Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals (HHCs) at the South Canadian Waste Water Treatment Plant (WWTP).



The RMP/PSM Plan is intended to assist those who may be affected by HHCs to be able to identify and understand the hazards posed by the processes that involve those chemicals.  The only HHCs currently present at the South Canadian WWTP facilities above RMP/PSM Program applicability threshold quantities are chlorine and sulfur dioxide, which is stored as a compressed gas in 1 ton cylinders.  Cylinders of compressed chlorine gas and sulfur dioxide are used in the wastewater treatment process.  



This RMP/PSM Plan is intended to prevent the occurrence of, or minimize the consequences of, catastrophic releases.  It is a written program stating South Canadian WWTP policies and procedures for the management of chlorine and sulfur dioxide storage and use hazards in design, construction, start-up, operation, inspection, maintenance and training related to the OSHA Standard.



The RMP/PSM Plan requires employee participation.  Therefore, the South Canadian WWTP RMP/PSM Plan is intended to: 



(1) Work with employees and their representatives on the development of Consequences Of Deviation (COD) 

(2) Work with employees and their representatives on the development of Process Hazard Analyses (PHA),

(3) The development of the OSHA Standard's other elements of process safety management, and 

(4) Rrovide to employees and their representatives access to the process hazard analyses and all other information required to be developed under the Standard.



This RMP/PSM Plan will be regularly reviewed and updated whenever necessary to reflect new or modified tasks and procedures.



A copy of the w

ritten elements of the RMP/PSM Plan, as well as the other documents and reports that are created pursuant to this Plan are accessible to all employees who work in the South Canadian WWTP and made available to other affected persons in accordance with applicable EPA and OSHA requirements.



It is Inframark's philosophy in operating the South Canadian WWTP, to continually improve the safe working conditions of its employees to minimize accidents and reduce the potential for either an on-site or off-site release.
